title: Semantik Architect  Frame: Meta section summary

frame_type.description: Canonical frame identifier for section-level meta frames.

section_id.description: Logical identifier for the section, typically a language-neutral code such as 'lead', 'early_life', 'career', 'works', 'legacy', or a slug derived from a heading.

heading.description: Human-readable heading text for this section in the working language, e.g. 'Early life', 'Career'. Optional; some callers may infer headings from section_id.

level.description: Hierarchical level of the section. Conventionally: 1 = top-level/lead, 2 = h2, 3 = h3, and so on.

parent_section_id.description: Optional identifier of a parent section for nested structures. If null, this section is considered top-level within the article.

subject_time_span.description: Optional time span describing the temporal scope of the subject in this section (e.g. early life years, a particular period of a war). Shape follows semantics.types.TimeSpan.

topic_span_description.description: Optional free-text, language-neutral description of what temporal or logical span this section covers, suitable as a semantic hint for planners.

frames.description: List of semantic frames (entity/event/relational/narrative, etc.) that should be realized in this section. Each entry is typically one of the core frame types (bio, entity.organization, event.* , relation.*, aggregate.*), serialized according to its own schema.

ordering_hint.description: Optional hint for ordering/rendering of frames within this section, e.g. 'chronological', 'by_importance', 'group_by_theme'.

max_frames.description: Optional soft cap on how many frames from `frames` should actually be realized when generating text. Planners may use this to truncate very dense sections.

attributes.description: Optional additional structured attributes at the section level (e.g. UI hints, layout preferences) that are not yet promoted to first-class fields.

extra.description: Free-form metadata for project-specific extensions (provenance, original section ids, debugging info). Not interpreted by core semantics.
